title: Citi Trinidad & Tobago Honors Bank Alumni
summary: Port of Spain, Trinidad - Citi Trinidad & Tobago hosted a Citi Alumni event at which the bank recognized alumnus Joy Caesar for her commitment and contributions to the community. The Citi Alumni Awards distinguish the accomplishments of the organization's former employees who still make Citi very proud, in the areas of Leadership & Ingenuity, Network Development and Community Involvement. Joy Caesar was awarded the 2013 Citi Distinguished Alumni Award for Community Involvement.
tag-1: Citi Trinidad & Tobago Honors Bank Alumni
tag-2: Port of Spain, Trinidad – Citi Trinidad & Tobago hosted a Citi Alumni event at which the bank recognized alumnus Joy Caesar for her commitment and contributions to the community. The Citi Alumni Awards distinguish the accomplishments of the organization's former employees who still make Citi very proud, in the areas of Leadership & Ingenuity, Network Development and Community Involvement. Joy Caesar was awarded the 2013 Citi Distinguished Alumni Award for Community Involvement.
tag-3: The organization received an extensive pool of nominees submitted by alumni delegates and Citi Country Officers from around the world. A council composed of several Citi executives, as well as an external Alumni Ambassador, selected the 40 winners.
tag-4: Dennis Evans, Trinidad Citi Country Officer, said, "Joy is an extraordinary human being who truly goes above and beyond with all the work she does for our community, and we are very pleased to have her as part of the Citi family. During our 48-year history, Citi's alumni have contributed greatly to the development of our organization, and it's thanks to their work and dedication that Citi is the bank it is today."
tag-5: Trinidad's Joy Caesar has dedicated more than two decades to her passion for music, serving as Musical Director and Conductor of The Southernaires Choir of San Fernando. She has conducted performances with the local choir, as well as regional and international presentations for many dignitaries, including Archbishop Desmond TuTu and Her Majesty the Queen of Great Britain.
tag-6: Joy has also held executive positions on many Community and Cultural Boards throughout the country. She has been distinguished with the Hummingbird Bird Gold Medal, and the nation's second-highest honor – The Chaconia Gold Medal for her outstanding service to Trinidad & Tobago in the field of Music & Community Service. Joy retired from Citibank in 2002 after a successful career, during which she held various roles including Country Human Resource Officer and Head of Public Affairs.
tag-7: Citi's Alumni Network allows those who helped build the bank's history come together and network with current employees, keeping them engaged and strengthening ties as well as establishing new relationships. The Alumni Network was successfully launched in Trinidad & Tobago in April last year.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
